parameters.name: country.code
parameters.description: CountryCode

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: provide expand=subCategories when applicable

parameters.name: city.code
parameters.description: City code

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: optional country of origin

parameters.name: minDuration
parameters.description: optional minimum duration - default 3 days

parameters.name: maxBudget
parameters.description: optional minimum budget - default 100000

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: optional - select the size of the resultset, no restriction, when the complete result set is required set this value to 2147483647 for example

parameters.name: minDepartureDate
parameters.description: optional minimum departure date

parameters.name: maxDepartureDate
parameters.description: optional maximum departure date

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: optional magical q parameter! Support for a custom filter DSL which is a the moment quite limited in functionality and supports only a single field, but its functionality will be expanded in future versions. For now it can be used as a filter to search for partial strings. Sample: /some/api/url?q=name.contains(dam) This will search the response for a field called name (nested fields can be selected by point navigation, for example airport.name). If no such field can be found the service will respond with a HTTP 400 Bad Request instead of ignoring the invalid filter. When it locates the field it will restrict the retrieved result set based on the provided query, so .contains(dam) does exactly what it suggests, it will filter the result set and return only elements that have a name field that contain dam.

parameters.name: themes
parameters.description: optional list of comma separated theme codes

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: optional comma separated expansions (currently supports only lowest-fare)

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: optional - select the ordering, possible values are 'DESC' or 'ASC'

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: optional field to be sorted, can only be string or numeric numeric

parameters.name: origins
parameters.description: optional comma separated list of origin airport codes

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: optional - select an available page

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: optional language parameter for i18n

parameters.name: minBudget
parameters.description: optional minimum budget - default 0

parameters.name: maxDuration
parameters.description: optional maximum duration - default 20 days

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: ISO city code

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Country code

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: optional magical q parameter! Support for a custom filter DSL which is a the moment quite limited in functionality and supports only a single field, but its functionality will be expanded in future versions. For now it can be used as a filter to search for partial strings. Sample: /some/api/url?q=name.contains(dam) This will search the response for a field called name (nested fields can be selected by point navigation, for example airport.name). If no such field can be found the service will respond with a HTTP 400 Bad Request instead of ignoring the invalid filter. When it locates the field it will restrict the retrieved result set based on the provided query, so .contains(dam) does exactly what it suggests, it will filter the result set and return only elements that have a name field that contain dam.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Indicates the response type expected.

parameters.name: AFKL-TRAVEL-Host
parameters.description: Indicates the host that is to be used to create the response. e.g. 'AF' (AirFrance) or 'KL' (KLM)

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Indicates the response country and language expected. e.g. nl-NL indicates language=nl (Ducth) & country=NL (Netherlands)

parameters.name: AFKL-TRAVEL-Host
parameters.description: Indicates the host that is to be used to create the response. e.g. 'AF' (AirFrance) or 'KL' (KLM)

parameters.name: d
parameters.description: Base64 encoded, zipped JSON request body. Except for dateInterval.

parameters.description: Indicates the host that is to be used to create the response. e.g. 'AF' (AirFrance) or 'KL' (KLM)

parameters.name: dateInterval
parameters.description: Date interval to be used for the connection of interest.  Format: YYYY-MM-DD/YYYY-MM-DD NB Currently only support for one dateInterval, so for RETURN offers only.

parameters.name: X-Mashery-Oauth-User-Context
parameters.description: This context is provided by Mashery. As long as the provided token remains valid, Mashery will inject the session scoped headers into the request before passing it on to the target API. This functionality is currently fairly limited, but it provides a way to propagate the Customer's information to propagate over all API's.  The value of this header is determined and set by the AuthServ4Cust for B2C, and B2EAuthServer for B2E, at the moment of initial request of an OAuth2 Access Token. See example on Confluence https://confluence.eden.klm.com/display/KLMAPI/Context+Parameters

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: In case requested language in not supported (see Get/lounges for supported languages), by default, system will return response in 'English'

parameters.name: AFKL-TRAVEL-Channel
parameters.description: The consuming channel - Internet Checkin/Kiosk/Mobile et..  The channel is also required for executing business rules, and Printing Boarding and other documents.  Business rules and database settings are channel specific. And also in the formats of the printed documents are different for each channel.

parameters.name: X-Mashery-Oauth-Scope
parameters.description: This context is provided by Mashery. As long as the provided token remains valid, Mashery will inject the session scoped headers into the request before passing it on to the target API. The value of this header is determined and set by the AuthServ4Cust for B2C, and B2EAuthServer for B2E, at the moment of initial request of an OAuth2 Access Token. See example on Confluence https://confluence.eden.klm.com/display/KLMAPI/Context+Parameters

get.summary: SSR Offer is only provided when: <ul>  <li>There i...
get.description:
SSR Offer is only provided when:
  • There is at least one KL operated flight in the itinerary of the reservation
  • All flight segments in the itinerary have a confirmed status (HK)

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: the required productClass

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: message version

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: 2-letter languagecode

post.summary: Cart Integrity It has to be prevent...
post.description:
Cart Integrity It has to be prevented that duplicate products are added to the cart. Error PRDS 0014 is returned for:
  • Product with productClass 'seat', 'meal' or 'lounge' when Product with same productClass already in cart for: - same Passenger and for: - same Segment
  • Product with productClass 'luggage' when Product with same productClass already in cart for: - same Passenger and for: - same Connection
  • Product with productClass 'environmental' when Product with same productClass already in cart for: - same Passenger
  • Product with productClass 'FlexibilityProduct' or 'InsuranceProduct' when Product with same productClass already in cart.
  • Product with productClass 'MissedFlightCoverProduct' when Product with same productClass already in cart for: - same Connection
  • Product with same productName for productClass 'Connectivity' already in cart for: - same Passenger and for: - same Segment
Seating: It also has to be prevented that not-available seats are added to the cart. Only seats with status FREE can be added to the cart. Error PRDS 0015 is returned (cart update failed). Connectivity: Multiple of the same product for a passenger/segment can be added to the cart. The maximum is set to 100, when it it exceeds 100 return error PRDS 0017 - Maximum number of same products for a passenger/segment in cart is 100.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: message version

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: 2-letter languagecode

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: if only specific checkindocuments are required, specify the required documents. Without the include/exclude parameter all available/eligible checkin documents will be returned.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: if specific checkindocuments are not required, specify the not required documents. Without the include/exclude parameter all available/eligible checkin documents will be returned.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: This optional parameter is to be set when the Create Shop flow needs to be avoided.  This will save altea calls and improve performance. Without the shop link, consumers will not be able to do seat change/buy products.  when this parameter is not passed, default behavior is that shop will be created when applicable(after checkin).

parameters.name: ReferenceData.role
parameters.description: view=referencedata can be extended by a specific type of reference data if not all are required. Example view=referencedata&type=Title

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Accept header for passbook

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: The last name of one of the passengers in the reservation.

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: The first name associated with the passenger.  Used to uniquely identify a passenger in the special reservation type 'group reservation'.

parameters.name: ticketNumber
parameters.description: The ticket number associated with the passenger.   Used to uniquely identify a passenger in the special reservation type 'group reservation'.

parameters.name: bookingCode
parameters.description: The code uniquely identifying a reservation within the reservation system. Note that bookingCodes tend to get re-used for other reservations some time after the last segment in it has been flown.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: To specify the version of the reservation API to use. The API will use a default version when not specified. E.g. to use v2 pass this blurb: application/hal+json;profile=com.afklm.reservation.v2

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: ISO language - localizes content in the response. When not specified will assume 'en'.  Sample values: en-GB, nl, ru-RU

LowestFareOffers.description: Lowest-fare-offers request the lowest available fare offers.  HTTP method is POST and request parameters are specified in the message body. Request contains number of passengers per type, type of request, cabin class, currency (optional) and a list of connections.

cabinClass.description: Code for cabin class. Either ECONOMY or BUSINESS for now.

displayType.description: Indicates the rules to use for determining the display price. This can be used to override the POS default setting.

passengerCount.description: Describes the number of passengers. Total number of passengers must be 1-9.

ADULT.description: Number of adults. 12 years and older.

currency.description: Indicates the currency to be used for prices in response.  Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217. If not specified the default currency is taken from POS.

includeCarriers.description: List of marketing carriers to include in the request.

minimumAccuracy.description: Threshold for accuracy. Overrides default threshold. When accuracy is below supplied threshold, backend will switch to more accurate source. NB Currently TripPlanner GetBudgetSearch is fast, less accurate source and TripPlanner GetData is more accurate source..

type.description: Indicates the type of FlightOffer request being fired.

items.description: Specification of a connection as part of request. Connection is specified by EITHER origin and destination (any flight) OR ordered list of segments (selected flight).

maxDaysOfStay.description: Maximum days of stay at the destination of the Connection.

minDaysOfStay.description: Minimum days of stay at the destination of the Connection.

origin.description: StationView is helper object. StationView is specified by EITHER City OR Airport.

city.description: City is an IATA defined location where an Airport is located.

airport.description: Airport is an IATA defined location. Airport can actually be a location of type: 1 - Off-Line Point 2 - Metropolitan Area 3 - Airport 4 - Bus Station 5 - Railway Station 6 - Heliport 7 - Ferry Port

destination.description: StationView is helper object. StationView is specified by EITHER City OR Airport.

city.description: City is an IATA defined location where an Airport is located.

airport.description: Airport is an IATA defined location. Airport can actually be a location of type: 1 - Off-Line Point 2 - Metropolitan Area 3 - Airport 4 - Bus Station 5 - Railway Station 6 - Heliport 7 - Ferry Port

dateInterval.description: String representing a date interval according to RFC3339, period-explicit. Format is: 'YYYY-MM[-DD]/YYYY-MM[-DD]'.  Date interval describes the range of dates that should be used to find lowest fares/flights for the Connection

items.description: Segment is a direct flight from its origin to its destination.

origin.description: Airport is an IATA defined location. Airport can actually be a location of type: 1 - Off-Line Point 2 - Metropolitan Area 3 - Airport 4 - Bus Station 5 - Railway Station 6 - Heliport 7 - Ferry Port

destination.description: Airport is an IATA defined location. Airport can actually be a location of type: 1 - Off-Line Point 2 - Metropolitan Area 3 - Airport 4 - Bus Station 5 - Railway Station 6 - Heliport 7 - Ferry Port

departureDateTime.description: DateTime of departure of the segment flight. It is specified as local time at origin of the segment.

number.description: Max of four digits, when less than 3 then prefix with zeroes up till 3 digits. For example: 006, 022, 1001.

carrier.description: Carrier that is connected to the flight. Can be different for MarketingFlight and OperatingFlight.

shortest.description: Indicates whether shortest route should be found.

AvailableOffers.description: Available-offers request the lowest available flight offers.  HTTP method is POST and request parameters are specified in the message body. Request contains number of passengers per type, cabin class, currency (optional) and a list of connections.

cabinClass.description: Code for cabin class. Either ECONOMY or BUSINESS for now.

displayType.description: Indicates the rules to use for determining the display price. This can be used to override the POS default setting.

passengerCount.description: Describes the number of passengers. Total number of passengers must be 1-9.

ADULT.description: Number of adults. 12 years and older.

currency.description: Indicates the currency to be used for prices in response.  Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217. If not specified the default currency is taken from POS.

includeCarriers.description: List of marketing carriers to include in the request.

minimumAccuracy.description: Threshold for accuracy. Overrides default threshold. When accuracy is below supplied threshold, backend will switch to more accurate source. NB Currently TripPlanner GetBudgetSearch is fast, less accurate source and TripPlanner GetData is more accurate source..

items.description: Specification of a connection as part of request. Connection is specified by EITHER origin and destination (any flight) OR ordered list of segments (selected flight).

origin.description: StationView is helper object. StationView is specified by EITHER City OR Airport.

city.description: City is an IATA defined location where an Airport is located.

airport.description: Airport is an IATA defined location. Airport can actually be a location of type: 1 - Off-Line Point 2 - Metropolitan Area 3 - Airport 4 - Bus Station 5 - Railway Station 6 - Heliport 7 - Ferry Port

destination.description: StationView is helper object. StationView is specified by EITHER City OR Airport.

city.description: City is an IATA defined location where an Airport is located.

airport.description: Airport is an IATA defined location. Airport can actually be a location of type: 1 - Off-Line Point 2 - Metropolitan Area 3 - Airport 4 - Bus Station 5 - Railway Station 6 - Heliport 7 - Ferry Port

departureDate.description: String representing a date according to RFC3339. Format is: 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

items.description: Segment is a direct flight from its origin to its destination.

origin.description: Airport is an IATA defined location. Airport can actually be a location of type: 1 - Off-Line Point 2 - Metropolitan Area 3 - Airport 4 - Bus Station 5 - Railway Station 6 - Heliport 7 - Ferry Port

destination.description: Airport is an IATA defined location. Airport can actually be a location of type: 1 - Off-Line Point 2 - Metropolitan Area 3 - Airport 4 - Bus Station 5 - Railway Station 6 - Heliport 7 - Ferry Port

departureDateTime.description: DateTime of departure of the segment flight. It is specified as local time at origin of the segment.

number.description: Max of four digits, when less than 3 then prefix with zeroes up till 3 digits. For example: 006, 022, 1001.

carrier.description: Carrier that is connected to the flight. Can be different for MarketingFlight and OperatingFlight.

shortest.description: Indicates whether shortest route should be found.

host.description: Only applicable when 'accesses/registrations' is called to perform access/registration of the guest. When so, Customer.Access.id is the host id (of the host who is inviting a guest)

Retrievingeligibilityforrebooking.description:
For each connection in the itinerary returns
  • When eligible for re-booking: An URI (in an update element) the consumer can use to start the process to change an itinerary.
  • When NOT eligible for re-booking: The reason this connection is not eligible for re-booking.

UpdatingAPIS.description: Data, necessary for entering APIS eligible countries.

items.description: An address, as is to be provided as part of an APIS application. Can be either an address at destination or an address of residence.  See IATA AIRIMP section 3.13.3 - API - Passenger Address Information

zipCode.description: Zip/ postal code of the address

address.description: The street name and house number of the address

stateOrProvince.description: State or province the address is located in. The format is free text, but for USA and Canada two letter state abbreviations tend to be used.

type.description: The role the address plays in the APIS application.

items.description: A document necessary for entering APIS eligible countries.

number.description: The number of the Document.   Can have at most 15 numbers (including spaces)

Unique identification of a LoyaltyProgramMembership within a (normalized) LoyaltyProgram. For NormalizedProgramId = 'JSME' 2 letters and 5 numbers (e.g. NL12345) For NormalizedProgramId = 'MyAccount' the accountID. Note: this is NOT the GIN that is in use in front end applications. For Flying Blue (and all other IndividualLoayltyMemberships not being MyAccount): A number, usually about ten numbers long (e.g. 1234567890)

update.description: Reference to the location that can be used to update this membership.

items.description: An airline ticket is a document, issued by an airline or a travel agency, to confirm that an individual has purchased a seat on a flight on an aircraft.  In this POST request only the first Ticket is processed. Additional Tickets are ignored

A set of max 4 coupons belonging to a specific ticket. if one ticket holds multiple booklets, then it is aka conjunction ticket. In this POST request only the first TicketBooklet is processed. Additional TicketBooklets are ignored

number.description: Format of a valid Ticket Number is: Length 13 or 14 numeric characters without any blank/white space

acceptanceStatus.description: Collection of passengers from one or more reservations treated as a group for check-in related actions

type.description: Formally, the passenger type needs to be compliant with the dateOfBirth and arrivalDateTime of the last connection in the reservation. This is beyond the scope of check-in, where the last connection in the Reservation is not known.

items.description: Show a specific condition that a Passenger or the complete CheckinGroup must confirm to able to get accepted. Example: Typological Fares (Passenger on Student Fare needs to present Student Card to airline employee), Security questions

code.description: Unique code of the condition within the checkingroups resource instance

confirmed.description: Indicates if condition has been confirmed

type.description: Formally, the passenger type needs to be compliant with the dateOfBirth and arrivalDateTime of the last connection in the reservation. This is beyond the scope of check-in, where the last connection in the Reservation is not known.

items.description: Show a specific condition that a Passenger or the complete CheckinGroup must confirm to able to get accepted. Example: Typological Fares (Passenger on Student Fare needs to present Student Card to airline employee), Security questions

code.description: Unique code of the condition within the checkingroups resource instance

confirmed.description: Indicates if condition has been confirmed

type.description: Formally, the passenger type needs to be compliant with the dateOfBirth and arrivalDateTime of the last connection in the reservation. This is beyond the scope of check-in, where the last connection in the Reservation is not known.

items.description: Show a specific condition that a Passenger or the complete CheckinGroup must confirm to able to get accepted. Example: Typological Fares (Passenger on Student Fare needs to present Student Card to airline employee), Security questions

code.description: Unique code of the condition within the checkingroups resource instance

confirmed.description: Indicates if condition has been confirmed

type.description: Formally, the passenger type needs to be compliant with the dateOfBirth and arrivalDateTime of the last connection in the reservation. This is beyond the scope of check-in, where the last connection in the Reservation is not known.

items.description: Show a specific condition that a Passenger or the complete CheckinGroup must confirm to able to get accepted. Example: Typological Fares (Passenger on Student Fare needs to present Student Card to airline employee), Security questions

code.description: Unique code of the condition within the checkingroups resource instance

confirmed.description: Indicates if condition has been confirmed

items.description: A Connection is a set of sequential segments on which the passenger can travel from an origin to a destination

id.description: The connection(s) for which the check-in action is requested must be passed in the request.  Note: passing only the id of the return connection in case of a day return is not supported yet

items.description: Show a specific condition that a Passenger or the complete CheckinGroup must confirm to able to get accepted. Example: Typological Fares (Passenger on Student Fare needs to present Student Card to airline employee), Security questions

code.description: Unique code of the condition within the checkingroups resource instance

confirmed.description: Indicates if condition has been confirmed

items.description: In this POST request only the first Passenger is processed. Additional Passengers are ignored.

firstName.description: first name as recorded in Amadeus

lastName.description: last name as recorded in Amadeus

items.description: In this POST request only the first connection is processed. Additional Connections will be ignored.
Segment from Network perspective. Not the Segment as currently known in Checkin. In this POST request only the first Segment is processed. Additional Segments are ignored.
In this POST request only the first Passenger is processed. Additional Passengers are ignored
The container of 1 or more TicketBooklets belonging to one Passenger in one Reservation In this POST request only the first Ticket is processed. Additional Tickets are ignored.

A set of max 4 TicketCoupons belonging to a specific ticket. If one ticket holds multiple booklets, then it is also known as a conjunction ticket In this POST request only the first TicketBooklet is processed. Additional TicketBooklets are ignored.

number.description: Length 13 or 14 digits only so any request should not contain a dash, hyphen, spaces or other not numeric characters

itinerary.description: A set of one or more connections booked in one Reservation

items.description: A Connection is a set of sequential segments on which the passenger can travel from an origin to a destination In this POST request, only the first Connection is processed. Additional Connections will be ignored

The smallest piece of the Network that a passenger is able to book as (part of) a Connection. A coupon will be issued for each Segment In this POST request only the first Segment is processed. Additional Segments will be ignored

operatingFlightSegment.description: The (part of the) Flight that operates the Segment

number.description: Max 4 character string containing the numeric part of the flight designator (leading zeroes will be added upto 3 digits). Example 006, 022, 1001. Please refer to IATA AIR IMP Section 2.8.2

code.description: Max 3 character alphanumeric airline code (IATA). Examples: KL, AF, A5, etc.

number.description: Max 4 character string containing the numeric part of the flight designator (leading zeroes will be added upto 3 digits). Example 006, 022, 1001. Please refer to IATA AIR IMP Section 2.8.2

code.description: Max 3 character alphanumeric airline code (IATA). Examples: KL, AF, A5, etc.

documentsToBeRetrieved.description: The set of CheckinDocuments that are requested to be sent to a DeliveryAddress

tagId.description: tagnumber in case of a re-print

numberOfTags.description: number of new bagtags to create

items.description: In this POST request only the first DeliveryOption is processed. Additional DeliveryOptions are ignored. This might change in future releases when multiple (byte encoded) on_device documents can be combined.

In this POST request only the first DeliveryOption is processed. Additional DeliveryOptions are ignored. This might change in future releases when multiple (byte encoded) on_device documents can be combined.

boardingPass.description:
• It is a representation (view) of passenger segment(s) data that is required for boarding.
  • It contains among others a bar code.
  • If a BoardingPass has an association with more than 1 BoardingPassSegment it is a MultiSegment BoardingPass

items.description: In this POST request only the first DeliveryOption is processed. Additional DeliveryOptions are ignored. This might change in future releases when multiple (byte encoded) on_device documents can be combined.
The set of CheckinDocuments that are requested to be sent to a DeliveryAddress

tagId.description: tagnumber in case of a re-print

numberOfTags.description: number of new bagtags to create

boardingPass.description:
• It is a representation (view) of passenger segment(s) data that is required for boarding.
  • It contains among others a bar code.
  • If a BoardingPass has an association with more than 1 BoardingPassSegment it is a MultiSegment BoardingPass

passengerTransferInformation.description: A Connection is a set of sequential segments on which the passenger can travel from an origin to a destination

id.description: The connection(s) for which the check-in action is requested must be passed in the request.  Note: passing only the id of the return connection in case of a day return is not supported yet

passengerInformation.description: Collection of passengers from one or more reservations treated as a group for check-in related actions

dateOfBirth.description: Format: ISO 8601 RFC3339 Cannot be in the future.

type.description: Formally, the passenger type needs to be compliant with the dateOfBirth and arrivalDateTime of the last connection in the reservation. This is beyond the scope of check-in, where the last connection in the Reservation is not known.

dateOfBirth.description: Format: ISO 8601 RFC3339 Cannot be in the future.

type.description: Formally, the passenger type needs to be compliant with the dateOfBirth and arrivalDateTime of the last connection in the reservation. This is beyond the scope of check-in, where the last connection in the Reservation is not known.

dateOfBirth.description: Format: ISO 8601 RFC3339 Cannot be in the future.

type.description: Formally, the passenger type needs to be compliant with the dateOfBirth and arrivalDateTime of the last connection in the reservation. This is beyond the scope of check-in, where the last connection in the Reservation is not known.

dateOfBirth.description: Format: ISO 8601 RFC3339 Cannot be in the future.

type.description: Formally, the passenger type needs to be compliant with the dateOfBirth and arrivalDateTime of the last connection in the reservation. This is beyond the scope of check-in, where the last connection in the Reservation is not known.

advancedPassengerInformation.description: Passenger Information that needs to be shared in advance with authorities of the (intermediate) destination country(s). This is also known as the API destinations. The fields to provide are based on regularity requirements. Each element is accompanied with a required indicator; if this has value 'true' then it means that the element must be updated even when the element itself already pre-filled. Although it is possible to register advance passenger information per Segment in the Reservation, the information provided is consolidated across all segments. When provided in a request all segments will be updated with the same information Besides providing the information in case of a API destination it is also possible to store the same type of information for any other reason It is expected that the model will be changed in near future to be aligned again with the reservation API

items.description: Document that is used as formal identification of the passenger as required for API destinations. These documents can be primary identification documents like Passport, National ID or Military ID, or secondary identification documents like Permanent Resident Card, Border Crossing Card, US Naturalization Card, Refugee Reentry Permit. Secondary identification documents always need to be accompanied by a primary identification document.  Depending on the AdvancedPassengerInformation provided, multiple IdentificationDocument combinations may be allowed for acceptance. E.g. Passport and Permanent Resident Card or Military ID and Permanent Resident Card. IdentificationDocument details for one of those combinations need to be provided by the passenger, to be able to get accepted.

firstName.description: First name as it appears in the IdentificationDocument.

lastName.description: Last name as it appears in the IdentificationDocument

placeOfIssue.description: City where the IdentificationDocument is issued. This may also be the city where the consulate or embassy in a foreign country is located.

countryOfIssue.description: Country that issued the IdentificationDocument. This should not be confused with the country where the IdentificationDocument is issued (e.g. consulate or embassy in a foreign country).

mrzIndication.description: Indicates whether the IdentificationDocument is swiped and the document details are retrieved from the machine-readable zone.

destinationAddress.description: Address details applicable for the arrival destination of the Connection. Special instructions apply for passenger that transit to another destination country, go on a cruise or continue with train, bus, camper, etcetera.

town.description: Format: Alphabetic (A-Za-z), spaces allowed, max length 30

nationality.description: Nationality as is appears in you identification document Format: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2

countryOfResidence.description: The country where the passenger lives. Format: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2

items.description: Show a specific condition that a Passenger or the complete CheckinGroup must confirm to able to get accepted. Example: Typological Fares (Passenger on Student Fare needs to present Student Card to airline employee), Security questions
